intro: Andira anthelminthica var. acuminata, commonly known as the acuminata variety of the genus Andira, is a shrub or small tree native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many plants with medicinal and ornamental value. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. Its fruit is a capsule that releases small seeds when mature. This variety is notable for its potential traditional uses in folk medicine, though scientific research on its botanical properties remains limited.
